inn1.comm: starts off with a gentle loosener on off which is defended on the front foot by Sharjeel
punches this down the ground with a straight bat, with mid-off running to his left to field the ball
width given by Mathews, but Shehzad fails to put this away through the covers
this one is nudged towards midwicket by Shehzad
pitches this up a bit, and wide outside off, as Shehzad looks for the cover drive, but can't get it past cover
defends this one solidly off the back foot to bring an end to the first over
Rameez utters a premature 'bowled him!' as this one nips back slightly while going across Sharjeel, with this one chopped on to his toes, but evading the stumps
plays this one late outside off to get it past the man at point
plays this one uppishly towards midwicket as Shehzad is officially off the mark
this one delivered on and around off as Sharjeel caresses this down to point, with Dilshan doing well to dive and throw this back at the keeper's end
gets this to angle in on Sharjeel from round the wicket as he stands tall in defence
spears this on a fuller length as Sharjeel seems to hit this one as the ball thuds into his back pad. This one looked to be going leg side when Lakmal shouts an appeal, but the umpire calls it a bye
pushes this one down to short cover, who does well to field the ball
gets forward to defend this one down to short cover once more
overpitched from Mathews and Sharjeel obglies with a cracking drive through long-off, which beats the diving fielder stationed at mid-off to the boundary
angles his bat to turn this one to the leg side and set off for a quick single, which they are able to complete quite comfortably
this one is pushed down to midwicket for none
finishes off the over by batting this down back to the bowler off the back foot
this one is defended on the front foot down to mid-off
gets this to nip away on a good length, which Sharjeel edges through third man for a single
shapes this in from a length outside off as Shehzad defends to the leg side
caresses this one through the covers for a four
wide outside off and full as Shehzad lasers this one straight to short cover point, who gets behind it comfortably
outside off once again as Shehzad plays this one behind square to retain strike for the next over
full and going leg side as Shehzad pushes this down to mid-on
down the leg side as Shehzad clips this behind square for a single
wide outside off as Sharjeel drives this beautifully square off the wicket for four
drops this one short as Sharjeel swivels in an attempt to pull this in front of square, but fails to get a connection
gets forward to defend this one with a straight bat softly to the off side
content to shoulder arms and leave this away-going delivery outside off to the keeper
how easy was that from Shehzad? he just lofts this elegantly over the inner ring to find the extra-cover boundary
follows that up with the most outrageous hit over the long-on boundary, as this one goes really high up, before just clearing the boundary

Shehzad suffering from Afridi syndrome here as he looks to make it three out of three. Length ball delivery from Lakmal on middle which is hit straight up, with mid-off getting under it to take a simple catch. Shehzad gone for 17, and you have to say, the shot selection was certainly suspect
back of a length and defended solidly by Hafeez on the back foot
pushes this one up a bit further as Hafeez gets forward to defend this offering to the leg side
plays this one to the covers for a single to bring an end to the over
delivers this one just outside off as Hafeez gets forward in defence
brings the bat down to this one outside off as Hafeez plays this to cover
on the back foot as he looks to pierce the gap between midwicket and square leg
gets forward once more to this full delivery from Mathews
able to whisk this off middle down to backward square for a single
Sharjeel plays this one with soft hands as he looks for the gap on the off side
fuller length delivery which is pushed back to the leg side
fuller length ball which is defended this time towards the off side
threads this through extra-cover with the most sublime of drives as the length was right, and Hafeez is in just some kind of form
Hafeez is playing god mode at the moment as he glances this leg side delivery through the air over square leg and midwicket to find the square boundary
plays a classy stroke straight to mid-off. The follow-through alone warranted a boundary for that one
determined not to suffer the same fate as Shehzad as he allows this through to the keeper
pushes this fuller length ball straight to point
a lovely length this time as he bowls this on a fourth-stump channel which just nips away as Sharjeel goes for the drive
overpitched but not punished by Sharjeel as he plays this one straight to mid-off
gets this one to shape away from him as Sharjeel is fumbling against this lack of pace from Mathews
punches this off the back foot to point once more
and Mathews gets his maiden as Sharjeel drives this to cover to bring an end to the over
delivers this one on a leg stump as Hafeez eases this down to long-on
presses forward to neutralise the malice of this Senanyake floated on middle
goes over the top through extra-cover for a single
waits on the back foot before playing this straight to short leg
this time outside off as Hafeez drives off the back foot, but can't beat cover
once again gets back and eases this square off the wicket on the leg side for a single
too straight first up as Hafeez clips him comfortably through the leg side
better line as this one is bowled on a length on off, which Hafeez gets behind solidly
plays this one off the back foot towards midwicket
on the pads and Sharjeel helps himself by tucking this down to fine leg for a couple
plays a checked, lofted drive over extra-cover which fails to reach the boundary as the batsmen run three
drills this one straight to deep extra-cover as Malinga's first over comes to an end
strides forward to defend this one with soft hands
plays this one carefully towards the off side.
fails to get this past the off side as Sharjeel has been scratchy so far in his innings
plays this with an angled bat as the ball rolls towards point
prods forward to defend this offering back to the bowler
eases this one down to short midwicket
too straight again as Hafeez works this away straight to short midwicket
this one is defended back towards the bowler as Hafeez fails to get him away
whips this off his pads down to square leg for a single
fires in a slower ball yorker on middle which surprises the left-hander, as he ends up popping this straight up in the air, with Malinga running to his left to complete the catch
shoulders arms to this first back of a length ball which just leaves him as the ball carries to the keeper
length ball on middle which is defended solidly off the back foot
this one heading down the leg side as Hafeez clips this off the pads down to fine leg
this one is defended to the leg side
plays a lovely wristy drive through extra-cover to get off the mark. What a shot that by Maqsood. This one just raced across the turf
this time gets it away to the leg side with another wristy flourish
on the back foot to ease this behind square to fine leg
fires this wide down the leg side as the umpire confirms the signal
punches this square off the back foot down to sweeper cover
bowls a fantastic bumper which swings away as Maqsood withdraws his bat
defends this one solidly on the front foot to the off side
going down the leg side as Maqsood clips this straight to square leg
slower delivery down the leg side as the umpire signals a wide
shorter one which Maqsood is able to get on top off and work to the leg side for a quick single
gets this away down to midwicket. The pair wanted two, but Maqsood was not too keen
drives this one square off the wicket for a single
looks to play this down to midwicket, but can't get a single
tries to get him away to the leg side, but the spin surprises him there
bowling a similar line on leg stump as Maqsood is able to find the gap
floats this on off as Hafeez drills this straight to extra-cover
looks to steer this through the leg side, but can't get the single

what a stunner from Dilshan as Maqsood, looking to cut this away through point, hits this one a bit too high in the air as Dilshan takes a smart, low catch to his left. A wicket against the run of play there as Pakistan are now three down
decides to test the Pakistan captain with a shorter one which goes well over his head and is called wide
gets forward to this length ball to defend it to the leg side
plays this with soft hands to mid-on to sneak a quick single and get off the mark
punches this off the back foot down to extra-cover for an easy single
back of a length ball which is defended solidly by Misbah
too straight as Misbah just clips this off the pad down to square leg
in an attempt to get Senanayake off his leg stump line, Misbah gets low to reverse sweep, but the ball spins away from the blade
defended with soft hands towards the leg side
works this away to the leg side for a single
waits on the back foot before punching this in the gap on the leg side
helps this off his pads down to fine leg for a single
plays a lofted paddle sweep through the vacant fine leg region to take a single and retain strike for the next over
length ball outside off which is defended by the Pakistan captain
steers this through third man for a single
works this down to mid-off for none
plays the short-arm pull down to square leg for one
fires in a bouncer on middle which is ducked under by Misbah
gets forward to work this away with soft hands through the leg side, sneaking the single for good measure
down the leg side and called wide immediately by the umpire
Misbah plays this one tentatively towards short leg
once again attempts the reverse sweep, as Senanyake is not penalised for going down the leg side
this time steers this off his hips down to deep midwicket
able to work this down to mid-off for one
waits on the back foot before pushing this through the leg side
gets into position quickly to drive this off the back foot down to extra-cover
driven straight to short cover point
on the back foot quickly to pull this one down to deep square leg
defended with a straight bat to the leg side
tries to get this past backward point, but Dilshan is just lightning in the field today
angles his bat on the front foot to try and get it past Dilshan, but he is ever-so vigilant
clips this down to midwicket to sneak a single
starts off with a leg side delivery which is called wide
this time is worked away to the midwicket
drives this elegantly on the front foot down to extra-cover for a single
strikes him on the front pad, but this looked to be going down the leg side
plays this one down to extra-cover for one
back of a length outside off as Hafeez punches this down to deep extra-cover
steers this one down to long-on to retain strike for the next over
turned to midwicket, but can't get the single
angles this one square off the wicket on the leg side for one
able to ease this down to fine leg for one
fires this wide outside off as Misbah once again goes for the reverse sweep, but almost gets something on this, on the glove, and falls just short of Sangakkara who makes a dive to his right
this time employs a more orthodox sweep which just beats Malinga to the fine leg boundary
whips this off his pads down to deep square leg
tries to get this past point, but finds the fielder
this one stays low as Misbah looks to help this off his pads
leans forward to steer this through the off side
gets forward but can't find the gap on the leg side
once again tries to get this away on the leg side
presents an angled bat to cover the line to bring an end to the 24th over
nurdles this one through the leg side, but can't evade midwicket
this time goes for the more conventional sweep, with this one running down to short fine leg
tries to ease this past the square leg fielder
defends this one straight back to the bowler
down the leg side as Hafeez goes for the sweep, but fails to get any bat on the ball
this time is able to clip off his pads down to fine leg
finally able to get bat on ball with this reverse sweep, but succeeds in finding short third man straightaway
eases this down to long-on for a single
looks for the paddle, but then adjusts to push this through the off side
drives this one elegantly to the cover fielder
pushes this one down to Malinga at mid-off before setting off for a tight single, which the pair complete quite comfortably
this time steers through extra-cover
tries to get this past a diving fielder on the leg side, but the fielder does well to get a hold of it
defends this with a straight bat to the off side
presses forward to defend this one back to the bowler
defends this to the off side
and the first boundary in what seems like ages as Misbah pulls this powerfully behind square leg for four
tucks this away to the leg side for one
defends this one down to mid-on
punches this off the back foot down to long-on for an easy single
gets deep in the crease to cut this away to the third man boundary, with sweeper cover doing well to dive and stop a certain four
this one goes down the leg side as the keeper has a shy at the stumps
another punch through the off side, this time for two runs
steers this one through the leg side, but can't beat the fielder
going down the leg side as Misbah tries to help it along, but succeeds in only finding square leg
another wide down the leg side. Mendis has been horrid so far in his spell
gets forward to play this away through the gap between square leg and midwicket
on the back foot before cutting this away late to the third man fielder
this one is worked away down to square leg

Hafeez's series tally ends here as he will not get four 100s in the series, despite looking good for that today. This one stays low before angling in sharply on off stump, which Hafeez fails to cover for. Probably the only way you could dislodge this player on current form.
is solid in defence to the first ball he faces
once again forward to defend this one to the off side
gets back to try and whip this off his pads, but finds the fielder straightaway
leans into a drive through the off side, down to mid-off, before setting off for a quick single
gets low to defend this one back to the bowler
leans into another drive through the covers
attempts to cut this away through the off side, but can't get enough bat on it
shuffling in his crease before easing this through the leg side for one
presses forward to defend this offering to the leg side
defends this one off the back foot towards the leg side
nurdles this down to mid-on as Misbah is slowly putting me to sleep
defended back to the bowler by Akmal
width on offer but Akmal is unlucky to find short cover point
defended off the back foot by Akmal
defends this one to the off side to bring an end to the over
defends this one with soft hands close to the body
this one stays quite low as Misbah pulls in front of square
bowls the googly which stays straight on as Akmal looks to cut away
this time spins in on Akmal, who was definitely surprised as the ball rips into him
tries to get this away through the leg side, but fails

decides to leave this one pitching outside the line as it strikes him on the front pad. This could be the first decision for the ORS system, and it is. Front foot looking slightly dicey as it seems he may have overstepped here. Turns out that this is missing the stumps, so the decision stands as it is
length ball which is left well alone by Misbah
shifts the line a tad closer as Misbah runs this down to third man
gets tall before defending this back to the bowler
pushes this through the off side, but can't find the single
dances down but can't squirt this past mid-on
this one shapes in from outside off as Umar tries to steer this past backward point
tries to get this away round the corner for a single
plays this one softly to backward point for a quick single
gets back before cutting this away through point for two runs
strides forward to defend this one to the leg side
floats this on off as Akmal drives this firmly down to long-off
stays low outside off as Umar cuts this away to backward point to bring an end to the over
inside-edges this length ball onto the pads, with the ball rolling towards the off side
back of a length which is chopped down to third man for a single
cuts this away through point, but Dilshan is more than equal to the task
back of a length and coming in as once again Umar tries to run it down past short third man
defends this one just past the bowler to mid-off
back of a length as Umar tries to beat third man to the fence, but can't as the throw comes in from the deep, but not before the player sneaks two runs
turned to square leg
drills this straight to short cover
defends this one back to the bowler
plays this to mid-off for a single
dropped uses his feet well to clobber this square of the wicket, and almost holes out to deep square leg, who then fumbles the catch. That one should have been taken!
defended back to the bowler to bring an end to the over
times this beautifully through point off the back foot as Malinga is greeted with a boundary first up
gets forward to defend this one to the off side
slower ball on the pads which is turned off his hips down to fine leg
once again works this through the leg side as Misbah looks for the second, but Umar is not interested
too full as Akmal clips this one sweetly down to deep square leg
too straight once more as Misbah helps himself to a single down the leg side
on leg stump as Misbah eases this square off the wicket
drives this one straight to extra-cover
steers this through square leg for a comfortable single
pushes this one down to long-on
eases this down to long-on for one
poor delivery from the spinner which is rightly punished as Akmal gets deep in the crease before cutting through the covers for four
where did that come from? Misbah just stands and delivers by lofting Malinga over the midwicket boundary to bring up his 35th ODI fifty. Really came out of nowhere that one

and would you believe it? the first shot of intent and then he goes ahead and clips one down the leg side (which seems to be the favoured mode of dismissal today throughout world cricket), with Sanga taking a wonderful catch down the leg side. Malinga strikes and Pakistan are now 169 for 5
attempted slower yorker going down the leg side as this is eased down to deep midwicket
fires in a yorker on middle and leg which Anwar is more than capable to keep out
another yorker as Anwar tries to play this away through the leg side
back of a length which is run down to third man to bring an end to Malinga's over
caresses this off the back foot towards the covers
looking for a cheeky paddle sweep through fine leg, but Mendis strikes the pads, and he goes up straightaway, but this may have been going down the leg side

and after Akmal survived that, he goes ahead to find the softest of ways to hole out to Dilshan, stationed at short midwicket, who takes an easy catch. Pakistan now 173 for 6, and they still have over ten overs to go and make a competitive total
full from Mendis as Rehman looks to steer this through midwicket
traps Rehman with one that goes straight on

this time playing for the straighter one as the ball spins away, with Sanga taking it and then stumping Rehman in a flash. Umpire says not out, but Sanga is adamant, and calls for the review straightaway. Replays confirm that he was able to ground his toe in time.
almost edges this one outside off as Sanga claims the catch with a wild scream, but then has a knowing smile on his face. I think we all know that one missed
goes for the flick behind square on the leg side next ball
Rehman able to clip this down to deep midwicket to get off the mark
drives this one straight back, with the ball hitting the non-striker's stumps, as the pair are able to get a run

strikes him in line of the stumps and Rehman looked guilty as the umpire confirms the decision with the raise of his finger. With that Malinga now has four wickets, which has definitely been his best performance of the series.
solid in defence as Gul presents the straightest of bats to Malinga
steers this one down to long-on for a single
defends this one outside off with a straight bat
cuts this away down to sweeper cover to get Gul on strike
almost gets him on the stumps as this one turns into the batsman
dropped succeeds in getting an edge, low outside off, as it looks as thought Mathews may have grassed this chance
nurdles this final delivery down to long-on for a single
full and just outside off as Anwar Ali looks for the drive, with the ball beating the bat
plays another lofted flick down to fine leg, which affords him two runs
full on off as Anwar steers this behind point for a single
on the back foot as he plays this with soft hands to the off side
this one stays relatively low as Gul prods forward in defence
defends this slower ball on the front foot to bring an end to the over
floats this outside off as Anwar drives this down to mid-off
beats Gul's cut outside off, with the ball carrying through to the keeper
presses forward to steer this through the off side for a quick single
defends this one back to the bowler
short from Senanayake as he clips this to square leg for a single
helped off the pads as Anwar is able to return back for two runs
nurdles this one down to mid-on for a single. Sensible play here from the tail-enders
yorker on off stump as Anwar does well to keep it out
tries to find the gap on the leg side
yorker angling in on leg as Anwar is able to ease this down to deep midwicket
this one heading down the leg side as Gul misses out on a gimme ball, with this one hitting his pads after attempting a shot
length ball going down the leg side as Gul plays a neat pick-up shot to help this down to the fine leg boundary
this one is helped down to long-on for a single
works this away off his pads towards square leg

and the first calamitous error from the Pakistanis today as Anwar Ali, who had worked this to the leg side, tells Umar Gul to go back to his end, as Gul thought a run was on offer. Mendis picks up the ball and fires it in at the non-strikers, with Gul woefully short of his crease as he tries to ground his bat in vain. He is visibly upset with his partner on the other end. Will this spur him on to greater things come the next innings with ball in hand?
floats on middle which is steered down to mid-off for none
this one fired past the pads as the umpire calls a wide
able to clip this down to square leg, and the pair run hard enough to complete two
defended to the leg side by Anwar to bring an end to the over
steers this one straight to point

fired down the leg side, as he searches for the yorker, with Ajmal trying to hit this down the leg side, but this is called leg-byes by the umpire, and four of them at that. Sangakkara looking frustrated with that last one
full and on the pads as Ajmal looks for a non-existent run
plays this one with soft hands and close to the body as Ajmal is able to sneak a quick one. Good running that from the Pakistanis

Malinga strikes him on a leg stump line, and likes it straightaway as he fires an appeal at the umpire. Anwar asks for the review immediately. Malinga's front foot is fine. This one hits him just above the knee role, but is the ball clipping the stumps? The review shows that this was definitely missing the leg stump as the ball did too much. And with that the review works in favour of Pakistan

for a second I thought that was out as he hits this fuller one towards short cover point, but the ball bounced on its way to the fielder. Too bat the one-tip rules don't apply in international cricket. Perhaps he could have gone at that one, one-handed
goes for a sweep to one pitching in line on the stumps, and gets away with it as the Sri Lankans appeal for the wicket, but the umpire is convinced he got bat on it
full again as this time he lofts through long-off, with this one evading a diving mid-off to his right, and proceed to the long-off boundary
length ball which just shapes away as Anwar gets a thick outside edge, and thanks to some sloppy fielding in the deep, are able to come back for two

crashes this one off the back foot towards extra-cover, and yet another misfield by the player backing up allows for the extra runs. Sri Lanka have given away two needless runs. Will these come up to hurt him though?
this one spins away on a length as Anwar is all at sea
gets forward to play this with soft hands down to silly mid-off, and is able to sneak a run as well. Good running here between these two as the overs wind down
in line of the stumps as Anwar goes for an extravagant loft over extra-cover which lands safely at deep extra-cover
turns this one behind square on the leg side for a single
Anwar just smokes this fuller delivery, going down the leg side, over deep midwicket for a six, which just clears the rope

slower ball and Malinga is being taken to the cleaners as he lofts him over long-on to get into the 40s. This is turning out to be quite an inspired cameo from the Pakistan seamer, who has probably laid credentials to be a proper allrounder
tries to squirt away this fuller delivery on off, but Dilshan is more than equal to the task with a dive to his right to stop the ball in its tracks
honing in on middle as Ajmal plays a delicate paddle down to deep fine leg. Lovely stroke that from the Pakistani twirler
Ajmal plays an outrageous lofted shot over extra-cover that just reaches the boundary. Great start to the over as Pakistan need to pack on the runs

fired in on middle stump as Ajmal plays all around this one to be struck on the pads. They have a review in hand so they have decided to go for it. It looked out on first glance, but lets see what upstairs has to say. This one hits him full, but you can see middle and off, so is the ball creeping down the leg side? This one is shown to clip the leg stump, so Pakistan are officially nine down

going down the leg side as Junaid is struck on his pads as he walks across the stumps. If he hadn't done that, he may have survived. But since Pakistan are out of reviews, and the umpire's finger went up, it is all over.

inn2.comm: starts off with one at the hips which is glanced behind to fine leg to get Sri Lanka's chase off to a good start
short and wide and Dilshan obliges with a slap through the covers to register the first Sri Lankan boundary
back of a length and Dilshan chops it into the ground outside off. Didn't time that one really
back of a length as Dilshan is cramped for space, looking to play this one leg side
short and wide again as Dilshan flashes hard, with this one sailing over the slips to the third man boundary. Sri Lanka have got this chase off to a rollicking start!
coming in to the batsman as Dilshan plays this to the off side
doesn't start too well as this one is fired down the leg side
almost inside-edges this length ball going across him onto the stumps, but this one flies through the fine leg region

what a fantastic delivery from Anwar. Almost cuts him in half as this one nips back quite a way, with the keeper having to go to his left to collect this. Brought back memories of his exploits in the U-19 World Cup 2006 final
and then produces the other one which just holds its line as Dilshan has a waft at it
and then follows it up with another nipper-backer just outside off. Dilshan just doesn't have a clue at the moment
defends this one watchfully towards mid-on as Dilshan looks to survive through the over
moving away from the batsman outside off as Dilshan is content to let it through to the keeper
this one angles away outside off as Perera blocks to the off side
shaping away again outside off as Kusal plays this towards silly mid-off
length ball on and around off which is defended back to the bowler
length ball again on off as Dilshan defends to silly mid-off
punches this one straight to short cover as Dilshan looks to keep going at a decent clip
this one shapes in from a length as Dilshan fails to get this away
slams this one straight down the ground, and hit so ram-rod straight, that it almost takes out the umpire. Stunning shot that from Jayasuriya 2.0
back of a length and played towards the leg side by Kusal
Dilshan drills this fuller length ball straight to short cover point. Should have done better with that one as it was in the slot
defends this one solidly off the back foot towards the off side
back of a length in the same channel as this time Dilshan is able to get this to bounce over short cover point, and runs hard enough to complete the second.
punches this off the back foot straight down the ground, with mid-off doing well to get to his left and stop the ball
plays this one off the back foot with soft hands down towards mid-off, and is able to sneak the single
gets this to cut in from a shortish length as Dilshan is once again defeated by the pace. Gul utters a hopeful shout, but this was definitely going over and down the leg side
width given but all Dilshan can do is slap this straight to silly mid-off
gets this to angle in from back of a length as Dilshan is kept quiet once more
fires in a bouncer which Dilshan tries to pull through midwicket, but the bounce got the better of him. That is one for the over
once again short as Dilshan rocks on the back foot before powering this square off the wicket on the leg side to the boundary
Kusal is in a particularly malicious mood as he lofts him over the long-off boundary for four
I am pretty sure Jayasuriya is batting right now. He plays an outlandish heave over midwicket which just sails over the boundary. Has a beautiful arc on it as it goes onto the hill
and sensibly defends the next ball to point to ensure he doesn't give it away
lovely change of pace as Kusal sees it early to play a checked drive through the covers which gets him a single. Good cricket all around there
this one heading down the pads as Dilshan clips this gently to the leg side
length ball pushed across the batsman as Kusal wafts at it casually
Dilshan able to drive this through the covers, but doesn't get enough on it for it to reach the boundary
steers this one straight to silly mid-off
another magnificent shot from the Pocket Rocket as he lifts Gul into the midwicket stands with another clean strike
pitches this further up as Kusal is able to cover the line and block to the leg side
full and just outside off as Kusal defends this straight to short cover
plays a short-arm pull straight to deep square leg to finish the over
starts round the wicket to the left-hander as he inside-edges onto his front pad. They sneak the first run easily, but the second is afforded when no one is backing up for the throw
defends this one with soft hands towards the off side
waits on the back foot before clipping this down to midwicket

Kusal is definitely in a hurry to get this wrapped up as he sends another hit sailing over the ropes, this time over long-on. That's his third six already, and they haven't even got past the 8th over yet
defends carefully to the off side to keep himself on an even keel
this one heading down the leg side, but Kusal ends up spooning towards the off, but luckily out of the grasp of any fielders
starts round the wicket to Dilshan, who defends him watchfully to the off side
gets this one to climb from a reasonable length outside off as Dilshan has a go
fuller ball on the pads which is worked away to the leg side
back of a length and duly slammed over the long-on boundary. Kusal has decided that if its there, it has to go
pushes this length ball going across him towards point
back of a length on the pads as Kusal hits this behind square on the leg side to make it the fourth six of the innings. Have not seen Kusal cut loose like this before. Sterling stuff!
waits on the back foot before pushing this down to midwicket for a single
prods forward, with the ball ended up being played down to short fine leg
once again heading down the pads as Kusal fails to get this past short third man
defends this one watchfully with soft hands
once again has to defend as Ajmal has produced a good angle of attack

this one goes with the angle down the leg side and onto the pad. They go up for the appeal, but the umpire is not interested. Ajmal goes straight to the keeper, but it is decided that there is no need to review it
clips this one off his pads to the leg side
works this one off the back foot towards midwicket, but can not get the run
pushes this with soft hands to the off side before setting off for a tight single
waits on it before pushing off the back foot down to long-on
tries to beat midwicket, but the fielder does well to stop the ball
defended on the front foot to bring an end to the over
steers this down to long-on for an easy single
advances down but in the end defends it to the off side. Ajmal proving tough to get away
defends this one off the back foot to the bowler
once again defended by Kusal, who is looking slightly fidgety at the crease
chips this one over mid-on for a single down to long-on
Dilshan on the back foot before pushing this down to long-on to retain strike for the next over
able to tuck this away down to deep midwicket for a single

Kusal tries to be cute with a reverse sweep to find the fine leg boundary, but this one raps his front foot/pad on middle and off, and would definitely have hit the stumps. Kusal just threw away a glorious chance to capitalise and take Sri Lanka home with a big score
plays this one off the back foot to the off side
ends up hitting this one to the leg side as Kumar searches for his first run
and he gets it next ball with a poke through point
back of a length as Dilshan plays this to midwicket for a single
goes round the wicket to Sanga as the batsman fails to get him away on the leg side
defends this with a straight bat back to the bowler
tries to get him away behind square on the off side, but can't beat backward point
able to steer this down to midwicket for a single and get off strike
looking for the paddle over fine leg, but the ball ends up rolling towards the off side
looking for the expansive drive against the spin, but this one is mistimed towards the off side
back of a length outside off as Dilshan misses the late cut
on the back foot to play this with soft hands towards the off side
this time is able to nurdle it down to long-on for a single
defended back to the bowler by Kumar
defended solidly towards the off side as Sanga looks to play out the over
once again looking to penetrate the off side, but fails to do so
short, outside off as Dilshan rocks back to pull this in front of square down to deep midwicket
able to work this away down to square leg for one
played towards the leg side
able to lean in for the drive through extra-cover for a single
tries to get this away through the leg side, but short leg on the case
almost top-edges this sweep onto his face as the timing is well off
plays it back to the bowler, who is bowling at  him round the wicket
succeeds in getting this down to long-off for a single
this one does a bit too much as the umpire calls a wide
defended solidly to the right of the bowler
looking to get this past square leg, but the fielder is equal to the task
prods forward to clip this to square leg
steers this one down to deep midwicket to bring an end to the 17th over
and almost gets Dilshan straightaway with one that slides on outside off, with Dilshan looking to play the cut through point
plays this one straight to silly mid-off, with Sanga backing up quite a bit. The fielder takes a shy at the non-strikers, with the ball hitting the stumps, and allowing the run to go through
this one turns a great as Sangakkara gets forward, before the ball spins past his pads down the leg side, with the keeper collecting it
steered down to long-on for an easy single

gets an outside edge on it, with Junaid running hard to try and stop the ball from hitting the rope. Replays show that he unfortunately did touch the rope while trying to deflect the ball, so a four signalled by the umpire
defended towards the off side by Dilshan
punches this off the back foot straight to silly mid-off
off the back foot and played to midwicket
defended on the front foot
pushes this down to long-on for a single
steers this down to long-on for one
on the back foot as Sangakkara defends with soft hands
drives this one straight to silly mid-off to bring an end to the over
this one is angled down to the leg side for a single
nurdles this to the fielder at long-on for a single
plays a checked drive through the covers which almost gets to silly mid-off, but is able to avoid him
defends this off the back foot to the leg side
able to tuck this away down to deep square leg for one
width on offer as Sangakkara fails to cut this away past point
plays an elegant punch through the covers down to extra-cover
fails to get this away to the leg side
going down the leg side as the keeper collects it
manages to work this one down to long-on
caresses this off the back foot with some timing as long-off has to run quite a way to recover the ball
tries to get this to the right of the bowler, but Hafeez does well to get there
defended watchfully by Sangakkara to bring an end to the over
plays this off the back foot down to deep extra-cover for a couple
this one strikes him on the front pad outside off as Rehman has a shout
prods forward to defend this one back to the bowler
looks to steer this one past mid-off to find the single
advances down the track before angling his bat to get this down to deep midwicket
once again strikes him on the front pad, but this was hitting outside the line
back of a length and defended to the off side by Sangakkara
back of a length and worked away to the leg side by Sangakkara
back of a length and shaping in as this one is run down to third man
defended to the off side by Sangakkara
pushes this one right back to the bowler, who stops it with his right arm
unable to pierce the gap on the off side

strikes him once more on the pads, but doesn't Rehman know this is going down the leg side? Rehman asks the Pakistan think thank on the field, but they don't seem interested in pursuing it, since they only have the one review for the innings
pushed back to the bowler, who does well to field the ball

gets this one to spin away sharply outside off, with Dilshan playing for the turn. The keeper completes a quick stumping as they go upstairs to have a look. But replays show that he did indeed have a foot grounded behind the crease, so it's all good
turns this one behind square on the leg side for a single
goes round the wicket to Sanga, and gets it to drift inside, with Sanga playing outside the line. This could have bowled him through the gate
strikes him outside the line as the over comes to an eventful close
back of a length and Dilshan takes the bait, skying this high in the air over fine leg, with the fielder not making any mistakes. Ends a good innings from Dilshan
Sangakkara squirts one away behind point, but backward point makes an excellent diving stop to his right to stop the ball in its tracks
tucks this away through midwicket for a single
is able to get on top of this back of a length delivery on middle and work it to the leg side
steers this through point but can't beat the fielder
looks for the expansive drive through the covers, but instead gets an inside-edge to the leg side
steers this one outside off down to square leg
defended with soft hands outside offA R Raghuraman: "A question, why Akila Dananjaya is not seen recently? Jayawardene found out his talent as you know."
gets this to spin away outside off as Chandimal is struggling to pick the left-armer
plays this off the back foot straight to silly mid-off
once again defended watchfully with soft hands to the off side
pushes this one down to long-on for an easy single
Chandimal gets behind the line solidly
back of a length and punched down to silly mid-off
pushes this towards mid-on and sets off for a quick single. Anwar Ali hones on the ball and fires in a throw, and would have been out if the ball had hit the stumps
punches this off the back foot straight to backward point
tries to get this over the inner ring, but turns into a rather limp effort from the batsmen
cuts this away on one knee through point to finish the over

gets an edge which then travels straight behind, but the fielder coming in from backward point is able to recover it before it hits the ropes. Given as leg-bye as this actually struck the pad and not bat
steers this well enough to get this through the gap at third man to get three runs
plays this straight to silly mid-on
runs this one down to third man for a single
clips this off his feet straight to mid-on, with the pair running hard to complete the tight single
able to sweep this one from outside off down to deep fine leg
punches this off the back foot to deep extra-cover
back of a length and pushed back to the bowler
steers this one down to third man for a single
driven straight to mid-off

Junaid fires it at the leg stump as Sangakkara shuffles over to the off side in hopes of working him away through midwicket, but this one was way too far away as the leg stump goes for a holiday. Never seen Junaid scream like that. Almost burst a blood vessel I think
defended solidly off the back foot to bring a successful over for Pakistan to an end

pushes this towards the off side as the fielder sweeps in and throws one at the keeper, but it was wild, as the ball carries through to the other boundary for four extra runs. Looks like Shehzad was the guilty party there.

strikes the front pad as Rehman utters a huge cry, but doesn't seem too interested to pursue it. Replays show that it did hit the pad first before hitting the bat, but they can't go up now, and a missed opportunity has been had.
cuts this away in front of the stumps, but can't beat the inner ring
works this away to fine leg for a single
able to clip this off the pads down to square leg
defended back to the bowler to bring an end to the 30th over
defended to the fielder on the off side as Priyanjan looks to build an innings

back of a length outside off as Priyanjan gets a thick outside edge which carries low to the keeper, who is able to snaffle it. Pakistan slowly coming back into this contest, and the way the run rate has declined, they just need a few more quick wickets to put some serious pressure on the Sri Lankans
back of a length and defended solidly by Mathews to the off side
gets this to angle in but Mathews is equal to the task
defended back to the bowler by the Sri Lankan captain
played straight to short cover. Chandimal has not impressed me at all today
able to work this behind square for a single
defended solidly on the front foot by Mathews
once again blocked by the Sri Lankan captain
turns this away behind square on the leg side
steers this one through extra-cover to retain strike for the next over
on the pads as Chandimal angles this down to fine leg
defended straight to mid-off
tries to get this down the leg side, but instead is hit towards the off side
defended off the back foot as Mathews is struggling to get Gul away
fires in a bouncer which is immediately wided by the umpire for height
steers this one behind point down to third man for a single
another steepler outside off which is let through to the keeper
plays this with soft hands towards point
able to sweep this down to fine leg for a single
steers this straight to silly mid-off
plays a sweep, even finer, but can't beat fine leg
tries to nurdle this through midwicket, but silly mid-on gets there quite quickly to prevent the run
pushed back to the bowler to bring an end to the over
chips this through midwicket for a comfortable single
defends this carefully to the off side
played to the leg side, but Chandimal can't get the run
Chandimal presents the straightest of bats to defend this back to the bowler
surprises him with one that climbs a bit as this is blocked to the off side
squirts this away to square leg for a single and to retain strike next over
steers this one down to deep midwicket for a single
tries to get this away on the off side, but fails to do so
once again steered to deep midwicket
its almost as if it is just deep midwicket out there as for the third time in a row, they have played to that man
prizes for guessing where this one went? Yup, you guessed it. Deep midwicket
and as if they are trying to spite me here, this is once again played to deep midwicket. Someone tell them they are on a Powerplay here
tries to tuck this away to square leg, but can't get a run
turned to square leg, and despite some hesitation when the fielder has the ball in hand, decide to go for the second, and make it
played behind square leg for one
works this away to mid-on, and can't sneak a single
tries to cut this away through the covers, but finds short cover
defends this one back to the bowler to bring an end to the over
almost gets bowled by this one which straightens, but luckily catches the outside edge
defended straight back to the bowler
drives this one straight to deep extra-cover for one
lunges forward to block this offering from Rehman
once again defended by Mathews
gets this to spin away as Mathews plays inside the line, with the ball rushing past the outside edge
tucks this one round the corner, with the pair running hard to pinch a second
steers this one past a diving Ajmal to get this down to long-on
played straight to the fielder on the leg side
punches this off the back foot down to mid-off for a single
able to get this off the pads to the leg side for another quick single
plays this one to square leg but can't sneak the run
driven straight back to the bowler, who doesn't get his hands on it as it bursts through
defended with soft hands towards the leg side, but the keeper runs over to prevent the run
able to push this off the back foot, but can't get a run
once again looks for the run through the off side, but can't get it
able to steer this one off the pads to find the single
defended solidly to silly mid-off to bring to an end a terrific spell from Rehman
played straight to silly mid-off

charges down the track to try and force the issue, but this one inside-edges, or so it seems, onto the pads. Pakistan like it and have gone up for the review. The ball seems to have hit the back leg, but can't say for sure if it has inside-edged. The final decision is out, and to be honest am really surprised by.  Mathews is sent on his way, and all of a sudden the match is poised for both teams
gets this to rush across him outside off as the keeper collects the ball
and the first boundary in what seems like ages has been had with this streaky shot outside off, with no slips present. It took 109 minutes for that one. Enjoy it while you can.
similar delivery as the one two balls ago as this one rushes across to the keeper
defended solidly back to the bowler
steers this straight to silly mid-on
pushed to cover for a single by Chandimal
back of a length and rising as Vithanage gets this down to deep midwicket
gets this down to a squarish third man, and is able to run hard enough to complete two before the throw comes in from the deep
gets this past the bowler down to long-on for one
driven well into the gap at extra-cover as the pair run hard enough to get two
driven down to long-on for a single
tries to force this through the off side, but can't get it past the fielder
plays it right back to the same fielder as Pakistan are slowly getting an edge in this contest
runs this one down to third man
defended straight to the off side by Chandimal
tries to force the issue with a lofted pull, but doesn't time this well at all. Still able to complete two, although it was close as the throw almost got him at the striker's end
able to dab this down to fine leg for a couple
is able to get this past a diving short third man all the way to the fence. Seems like Vithu is the only Sri Lankan bat since Kusal who has found the boundary
steers this one down to long-off and is able to turn and complete the second in quick time
Ajmal has the last laugh as he bowls a doosra which bursts through the gate that Vithu leaves open. Huge wicket in the context of the game as Sri Lanka looked to break away here somewhat
spins this one into Senanayake as Chandimal wanted the run, and is able to get to the other end in time
pushes this one to the leg side to bring the over to an end
plays this one to the covers for a single
cut away through the covers, but straight to sweeper cover
this one is played square on the leg side for one
pushed off the back foot down to mid-on for one
defended off the back foot to short cover point

goes for the pull through midwicket but the length was not appropriate as he ends up skying this in the air with Hafeez getting under it to take the catch. Sri Lanka now seven down, and it is not looking very rosy for them at the moment.
back of a length and fails to get this through the leg side for a single
Chandimal plays this one to midwicket for one

Malinga goes for the big swing, and who can blame him, as he completely misses this one and gets his off stump knocked back. Ajmal has shown just how special a bowler he can be, especially in these situations

gets this to straighten as the batsman walks across his stumps, and it looked pretty adjacent when the ball struck in line. Sri Lanka have decided to review this, but I have to say, this looked out the moment it hit. No-ball is not a problem here. You can clearly see the leg stump, but because most of the ball was outside the line when it landed, so has been overruled. Turns out to be a good call from Chandimal
this time is able to pick a run through the leg side
steers this one down to long-on to end the over
works this off the pads and the pair run hard, putting pressure on the fielder in the deep, who then fumbles it, as they are able to make it back for three. That was Sharjeel who had goofed up there.
back of a length and defended with soft hands to the off side, setting off for a quick single which is, in the end, made quite comfortably

pulls this away behind square on the leg side as Sharjeel, running hard from square leg, gets the dive in to bat this away, but he may have hit the ropes, which he has on second view. Four signalled by the umpire
pushes this down to long-on, and wants two, but decides against it
length ball which is pushed to short cover
gets on top of it to defend this one to the off side
clips this off his pads down to the leg side for one
backs away to create room on the off side, but can't pierce the gap

dropped advances down the track and hits this uppishly to cover, who drops him, as the ball rolls through the off side, with the batsmen getting two. Maqsood dropped that one there, as it should have been taken
Mendis really has balls of steel as he looks for a paddle straight over his head, with this one almost bowling him, as the ball spoons towards the slip region
blitzes this one down to long-on for a single
gets into position for a reverse sweep and gets a crucial boundary between short third man and backward point. How important was that strike for Sri Lanka?
amazing strike from Chandimal! Definitely playing the innings of his year so far as he clobbers this fuller length going down the leg side over midwicket for a huge six
and then does the right thing next ball by steering this to backward point for a quick single
steers this one straight to cover, but can't get the run. 11 off 9 now

that shot may as well be called the game-over shot as it indeed looks to be game over. He just slams this short ball outside off so elegantly, and with a Jayawardene flourish, as this one sails over extra-cover for six.
bowls a steepler which Mendis is able to work away down to deep fine leg
plays this one uppishly down to long-on to retain strike for the next over. They need just 3 runs off 6 balls to make it 3-2 in the series
fails to get this back of a length delivery outside off
lasers this fuller length ball down to sweeper cover for a single
a slower ball outside off stump which Mendis fails to get bat on ball to
and with a slap over the extra-cover boundary Mendis finishes it off, not really in style, but finishes it off, as this looked more agricultural than finesse.
